name: Dryad
description: A Dryad has a slender, graceful form with bark-like skin and hair that flows like leaves. As a fey spirit bound to a tree, they serve as guardians of forests.
memorable: Dryads can magically charm creatures, communicate with animals and plants, and have a strong protective instinct towards their forest home.
goals: To protect their tree and woodland home, interact peacefully with those who respect nature, and charm potential threats.
relations: Often found in the company of forest creatures, they may also interact with other fey beings and druids.
environment: Primarily found in ancient forests, often associated with mighty oak trees.
strengths: Possesses strong charm abilities, magic resistance, and the unique ability to move through trees seamlessly.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to fire damage, which poses a significant threat to their existence.
attacks: Uses melee attacks with a club or vine whip, and can charm targets with captivating scents.
most_powerful_ability: Fey Charm allows the Dryad to magically charm a creature, making them see the Dryad as a trusted ally.
senses: Has a high passive perception of 14 and stealth capabilities for remaining unnoticed.
skills: Noteworthy in stealth, perception, and nature skills, enhancing its ability to navigate and manipulate its environment.
additional_information: Can move through trees, allowing swift escapes or ambushes.
Magic Resistance provides an advantage against spells.
Speak with Beasts and Plants facilitates communication with forest life.
Entangling Plants can restrain multiple creatures.
Summons animal allies when in need of assistance.
spellcasting: Innate spellcasting includes abilities to cast spells like entangle and goodberry, without needing material components.
test_queries: charming creature that can move through trees
nature guardian living in ancient woods
Dryad charms creatures while defending trees
